branch.description: The Git branch used to store the settings

autoUploadDelay.description: The amount of time to wait before automatically uploading. This is only used when `#watchSettings` is on.

path.description: The path to the export folder.

forceDownload.description: Controls whether or not remote settings will be forcefully downloaded, even if local settings are up to date.

forceUpload.description: Controls whether or not local settings will be forcefully uploaded, even if remote settings are up to date.

hostname.description: Hostnames are used by `Sync Pragmas` to differentiate between different computers.

ignoredItems.description:
Items that will not be uploaded, formatted as an array of glob strings. If a path matches a listed glob, it will be ignored.

See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glob_%28programming%29 for more information about globs.

profiles.description: Profiles can be used to sync different settings for different occasions.

url.description: The path to the Git repository.

syncOnStartup.description: Controls whether or not Syncify should run the `Sync` command when opening the editor.

syncer.description: The method used to sync your settings.

watchSettings.description: Controls whether or not Syncify will watch for local changes. If true, an upload will occur when settings have changed or an extension has been installed/uninstalled.
